result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason S. Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run - Attended vehicle, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason S. Vargas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
$831.00  Failure to pay, civil judgment.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Chavez acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes $300 fine plus costs, pay $200 DNA surcharge, 30 DTP or civil judgment.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA McNeill
Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty J Chavez appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Chavez states he would like to leave case set for trial; unsure why deft does not appear.  JSH continued to to 8/21/15 at 10am. Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 8/20/15 at 1:15pm and JS 9/8/15 at 8:30am, pick & go.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Aileen Henry (for Atty Jeremy Chavez).  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Henry requests time to review new discovery received from D.A.  Plea hearing 5/29/15 at 9:15.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill states she has failed to contact the victim since the last hearing, would like time to do so.  Atty Chavez states he had a private investigator try to locate victim and was unable to do so.  FPT continued to 5/8/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Chavez states the victim has not cooperated in providing a restitution amount, the State will attempt to contact victim and if no response the State's offer will be revised.  FPT continued to 3/26/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Chavez the FPT of 2/10/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 2/12/15 at 1:15pm.
Final pre-trial on February 10, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
With Atty Chavez the FPT of 12/11/14 at 2:30pm is rescheduled, as he has a conflict w/a hearing in Walworth county court; reset to 2/10/15 at 1:15pm.
With Atty Chavez the FPT of 10/28/14 at 8:15am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 12/11/14 at 2:30pm.

Judge Chad Kerkman, Acting Br. 6 for today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At request of Atty Chavez, pretrial adj. to 10/28/14 at 8:15.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Chavez states his investigator has obtained new information.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/6/14 at 3pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez for Atty A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Chavez states an investigator has been hired.  FPT continued to 8/27/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Chavez acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 6/20/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 7/15/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Jeremy Chavez. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 6-2-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

153pm
  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Clerk: KZ.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 5/21/14 @ 930am.  Signature bond continued w/same conditions (see previous bond entry).
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Atty AIleen Henry

127pm  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: LE  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Initial appearance adjourned to 5/16/14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk
